title: How to write an HTML page - Quora

response.answer_text:
You can use a text editor (like Windows Notepad or www.editpad.org) to write a code like this: Your Website

Article title

Posted on September 4th 2009 by Writer

Pellentesque habitant morbi tristique senectus et netus et malesuada fames ac turpis egestas.

and save in text-only format (.txt) as page.txt Rename the file extension to .html (page.html) and open in a web browser (MS Edge, Google Chrome, Safari, etc) yo see the result. If you want se e a more complex example access: HTML5 Page Structure | CSS-Tricks

If you want to really-really simple ever to write your really simple HTML page, try this. Open your Notepad;Type this:<html> <body> 	<h1>My First HTML Page EVER!<h1> </body> </html> Congratulations! You just write your first ever HTML page. Now the next step! Save it. On From the File pull-down menu, Select "Save As," save the file to the Desktop, and name the file using the ".html" extension (e.g., "home.html")On the Desktop, open it.Now you can see your first ever HTML page on your favourite web-browser. Congratulations! This is the references you might need: Using NotePad to Create HTML DocumentsHTML 5.1 2nd EditionThank you. I hope this will help you.
